discourse_list.title: Projects using Improvement Proposals for different types of governance

content.content: I just discovered that the Kickback event management platform is using Kickback Improvement Proposals – KIPs – for their platform:    GitHub    wearekickback/KIPs Kickback Improvement Proposals. Contribute to wearekickback/KIPs development by creating an account on GitHub.      I know that AION is also using Aion Improvement Proposals - AIPs – and had some of their community team attend Council of Prague.    Aion – 4 Sep 18    Leveraging the Power Of Community — Aion Improvement Proposals (AIPs) Open source software and projects are in a continual state of evolution and growth. Their objectives and roadmap must be flexible to… Reading time: 2 min read       Very interesting. Kickback team – would be lovely to read a blog post or interview or discussion on why you’re developing / using this KIP process. Is this more like feature requests? or? I’m fascinated! I definitely think a good interview topic for the future.
content.GPT-summary: The post discusses the use of Improvement Proposals (KIPs and AIPs) by different projects for governance. The author is explaining the concept of KIPs and AIPs and a third party expresses interest in learning more about the KIP process and suggests it as a topic for future interviews.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Hey, Ram from Kickback here. We’re experimenting with KIPs to see if this is a good way for us to discuss extensive changes to the platform and service. It’s also a great way of getting people who want to contribute large scale ideas to do so in a structured manner. The other thing I like about it is that it lets people in future go back and see a well documented specification of any changes that were made. People often point back to EIPs, often treating them almost as reference documentation.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party expressing interest in learning more about KIP process
3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
